org.gamelink.connect

Class Link

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gamelink.connect.Link

  • public class Link
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameLInk program implements an application that simply serves as a peer to peer messaging platform for turn based 2 player games (such as Cram or Kalah)
    Since:
    2015-06-18

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Link() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect(boolean useOwnIpAddress)
      Connects the player as either the Client or the Server depending on the players playerNumber.
      void connectAsPlayer1()
      Establishes the player as the server, creating a serversocket and supplying an IP address to be used by the client to connect.
      void connectAsPlayer2(java.lang.String addr)
      Establishes the player as the Client, creates a socket and uses the IP address provided by the Server to connect to said Server.
      void disconnect()
      Closes the connection between the client and the server, as well as the input and output buffers used for the transfer of information between client and server.
      java.lang.String getHostIpAddressFromUser() 
      java.lang.String getMsg()
      Receives a String msg from the connected user (used by both Server and Client).
      static java.net.InetAddress getNonLoopbackAddress()
      Returns the non-loopback IP address of the local machine, the address is used by the client to specify the hostname of the server
      void sendMsg(java.lang.String msg)
      Sends a String msg to the connected user (used by both Client or Server).
      void setPlayerNumber(int pNum)
      Sets the value of the playerNumber

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setPlayerNumber

        public void setPlayerNumber(int pNum)
        Sets the value of the playerNumber
        Parameters:
        the - playerNumber of the current user

      • getNonLoopbackAddress

        public static java.net.InetAddress getNonLoopbackAddress()
        Returns the non-loopback IP address of the local machine, the address is used by the client to specify the hostname of the server
        Returns:
        the InetAddress representation of the non-loopback address of the local machine

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Closes the connection between the client and the server, as well as the input and output buffers used for the transfer of information between client and server.

      • connectAsPlayer1

        public void connectAsPlayer1()
        Establishes the player as the server, creating a serversocket and supplying an IP address to be used by the client to connect.

      • connectAsPlayer2

        public void connectAsPlayer2(java.lang.String addr)
        Establishes the player as the Client, creates a socket and uses the IP address provided by the Server to connect to said Server.
        Parameters:
        the - String representation of the IP address of the Server

      • connect

        public void connect(boolean useOwnIpAddress)
        Connects the player as either the Client or the Server depending on the players playerNumber.

      • getHostIpAddressFromUser

        public java.lang.String getHostIpAddressFromUser()

      • sendMsg

        public void sendMsg(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends a String msg to the connected user (used by both Client or Server).
        Parameters:
        the - String message to be sent to the opposing player.

      • getMsg

        public java.lang.String getMsg()
        Receives a String msg from the connected user (used by both Server and Client).
        Returns:
        the String message sent by the opposing player.
